title: Fakhrul urges govt for swift action against attackers of Osman Hadi
body: Bangladesh Nationalist Party secretary general Mirza Fakhrul Islam Alamgir on Friday urged the interim government and the authorities concerned to take firm action over the shooting of Inqilab Mancha spokesperson and Dhaka-8 potential independent candidate Sharif Osman Hadi, who was critically injured after armed assailants opened fire on him in the capital. Fakhrul also wished a quick recovery for Sharif Osman Hadi, who is now undergoing treatment at Dhaka Medical College Hospital. In a post on his verified Facebook page shortly after 3:00pm, Fakhrul said he hoped that the interim government and the authorities concerned would take prompt and firm action over the incident. He wrote, ‘According to the information available at the moment, the independent candidate for Dhaka-8, Osman Hadi, has been shot and taken to the hospital. I wish him a quick recovery. I hope the interim government and the authorities concerned will act decisively.’ Fakhrul added that regardless of political ideology, anyone resorting to intimidation or force must be rejected collectively. Earlier around noon, assailants shot Sharif Osman Hadi in the Box Culvert area of Bijoynagar in the capital. He was moved to Dhaka Medical College Hospital in a critical condition.
